info.title: Challenge, Support, and Intervention Plan API
info.description:
API for retrieving and managing Challenge, Support, and Intervention Plan (CSIP) relating to a person.

This API is only intended for use by the CSIP UI and the prisoner profile. Any other proposed consumers of this API should discuss the requirements first with the current maintainers of the CSIP service. See the developer portal for this information.

## Authentication

This API uses OAuth2 with JWTs. You will need to pass the JWT in the `Authorization` header using the `Bearer` scheme.

## Authorisation

The API uses roles to control access to the endpoints. The roles required for each endpoint are documented in the endpoint descriptions.

## Identifying the user

The majority of the endpoints in this API require the user to be identified via their username. This is to correctly populate the change history of CSIP records e.g. who created or updated a CSIP record and for auditing purposes. The username is required when the service is called directly by a user or when another service is acting on behalf of a user. The method to supply the username is via the `subject` claim in the JWT.
### 4XX response codes related to username:

- A 400 Bad Request response will be returned if the username cannot be found in the user management service.

tags.name: 4. Investigations Controller
tags.description: Endpoints for Investigations And Interviews operations

tags.name: 6. Plans Controller
tags.description: Endpoints for Plans And Identified Needs operations

tags.name: 8. CSIP Admin Controller
tags.description: Endpoints for admin features such as search and reporting

tags.name: 6. Reviews Controller
tags.description: Endpoints for Reviews And Attendees operations

tags.name: 2. Referral Controller
tags.description: Endpoints for Referral and Contributory Factor operations

tags.name: 5. Decision And Actions Controller
tags.description: Endpoints for Decision And Actions operations

tags.name: 3. Safer Custody Screening Outcome Controller
tags.description: Endpoints for Safer Custody Screening Outcome operations

put.description:
Requires one of the following roles:
* ROLE_NOMIS_CSIP

401.description: Unauthorised, requires a valid Oauth2 token

Requires one of the following roles:

put.summary: Merge the referral with contributory factors
put.description:
Requires one of the following roles:
* ROLE_CHALLENGE_SUPPORT_INTERVENTION_PLAN__CHALLENGE_SUPPORT_INTERVENTION_PLAN_UI

200.description: Referral updated and contributory factors merged

401.description: Unauthorised, requires a valid Oauth2 token

404.description: The CSIP referral associated with this identifier was not found.

put.summary: Upsert a safer custody screening outcome to the referral.
put.description:
Create or update the safer custody screening outcome. Publishes person.csip.record.updated event with saferCustodyScreeningOutcomeAffected = true

Requires one of the following roles:
* ROLE_CHALLENGE_SUPPORT_INTERVENTION_PLAN__CHALLENGE_SUPPORT_INTERVENTION_PLAN_UI

201.description: Safer Custody Screening Outcome created on the CSIP referral

200.description: Safer Custody Screening Outcome updated on the CSIP referral

401.description: Unauthorised, requires a valid Oauth2 token

404.description: The CSIP referral associated with this identifier was not found.

put.summary: Add decision and actions to the referral.
put.description:
Create or update the decision and actions. Publishes person.csip.record.updated event with affected component of DecisionAndActions

Requires one of the following roles:
* ROLE_CHALLENGE_SUPPORT_INTERVENTION_PLAN__CHALLENGE_SUPPORT_INTERVENTION_PLAN_UI

201.description: Decision and actions added to CSIP referral

200.description: Decision and actions updated for CSIP referral

401.description: Unauthorised, requires a valid Oauth2 token

404.description: The CSIP referral associated with this identifier was not found.

409.description: The CSIP referral associated with this identifier already has a decision and actions

post.summary: Create a CSIP record for a prisoner.
post.description:
Create the CSIP record, referral and contributory factors. This starts the CSIP process. Publishes person.csip.record.created and person.csip.contributory-factor.created events

Requires one of the following roles:
* ROLE_CHALLENGE_SUPPORT_INTERVENTION_PLAN__CHALLENGE_SUPPORT_INTERVENTION_PLAN_UI

401.description: Unauthorised, requires a valid Oauth2 token

post.summary: Add investigation and any interviews to the referral.
post.description:
Create the investigation and any interviews. Publishes person.csip.record.updated event with affected component Investigation and person.csip.interview.created event

Requires one of the following roles:
* ROLE_CHALLENGE_SUPPORT_INTERVENTION_PLAN__CHALLENGE_SUPPORT_INTERVENTION_PLAN_UI

201.description: Investigation and interviews added to CSIP referral

401.description: Unauthorised, requires a valid Oauth2 token

404.description: The CSIP referral associated with this identifier was not found.

409.description: Conflict. The CSIP referral already has an Investigation created.

patch.description:

get.summary: Retrieve all CSIP records for a prisoner.

parameters.name: includeInactive
parameters.description: Include inactive reference data. Defaults to false

CreateInterviewRequest.description: The request body to create an interview

interviewee.description: Name of the person being interviewed.

interviewDate.description: The date the interview took place.

intervieweeRoleCode.description: What role the interviewee played in the incident or referral.

CreateInvestigationRequest.description: The request body to create an investigation on the incident that motivated the CSIP referral.

staffInvolved.description: The names of the staff involved in the investigation.

evidenceSecured.description: Any evidence that was secured as part of the investigation.

occurrenceReason.description: The reasons why the incident occurred.

personsUsualBehaviour.description: The normal behaviour of the person in prison.

personsTrigger.description: What triggers the person in prison has that could have motivated the incident.

protectiveFactors.description: Any protective factors to reduce the person's risk factors and prevent triggers for instance of violence

interviews.description: The interviews in relation to the investigation

CreateIdentifiedNeedRequest.description: The request body to create an Identified Need in a CSIP Plan

identifiedNeed.description: Details of the need identified in the CSIP plan.

responsiblePerson.description: The name of the person who is responsible for taking action on the intervention.

createdDate.description: The date the need was identified.

targetDate.description: The target date the need should be progressed or resolved.

closedDate.description: The date the identified need was resolved or closed.

intervention.description: The planned intervention for the identified need.

progression.description: How the plan to address the identified need is progressing.

CreatePlanRequest.description: The request for creating a CSIP Plan for a CSIP record

caseManager.description: The case manager assigned to the CSIP plan.

reasonForPlan.description: The reasons motivating the creation of a CSIP plan.

nextCaseReviewDate.description: The next date the CSIP plan should be reviewed.

identifiedNeeds.description: The needs identified in the CSIP plan.

CreateAttendeeRequest.description: The request body to create a Attendee/Contributor to the review of a CSIP Plan

isAttended.description: If the person attended the review.

CreateReviewRequest.description: The request body to create a Review for a CSIP Plan

recordedBy.description: The username of the person who recorded the review.

recordedByDisplayName.description: The displayable name of the person who recorded the review.

nextReviewDate.description: The date of the next review.

csipClosedDate.description: The date the CSIP plan was closed following a review outcome decision to close it.

actions.description: A list of actions following the review.

UpdateCsipRecordRequest.description: The request body for updating a CSIP Record

logCode.description: User entered identifier for the CSIP record. Defaults to the prison code.

referral.description: The referral that results in the creation of this CSIP record.

UpdateReferralRequest.description: The detail for updating a CSIP referral

incidentDate.description: The date the incident that motivated the CSIP referral occurred

incidentTime.description: The time the incident that motivated the CSIP referral occurred

incidentTypeCode.description: The type of incident that motivated the CSIP referral.

incidentLocationCode.description: The location of incident that motivated the CSIP referral.

referredBy.description: The person reporting the incident or creating the CSIP referral.

refererAreaCode.description: The area of work of the person reporting the incident or creating the CSIP referral.

isProactiveReferral.description: Was this referral proactive or preventative.

isStaffAssaulted.description: Were any members of staff assaulted in the incident.

assaultedStaffName.description: Name or names of assaulted members of staff if any.

incidentInvolvementCode.description: The type of involvement the person had in the incident

descriptionOfConcern.description: The reasons why there is cause for concern.

knownReasons.description: The reasons already known about the causes of the incident or motivation for CSIP referral.

otherInformation.description: Any other information about the incident or reasons for CSIP referral.

isSaferCustodyTeamInformed.description: Records whether the safer custody team been informed.

UpdateInvestigationRequest.description: The request body to update an investigation on the incident that motivated the CSIP referral.

staffInvolved.description: The names of the staff involved in the investigation.

evidenceSecured.description: Any evidence that was secured as part of the investigation.

occurrenceReason.description: The reasons why the incident occurred.

personsUsualBehaviour.description: The normal behaviour of the person in prison.

personsTrigger.description: What triggers the person in prison has that could have motivated the incident.

protectiveFactors.description: Any protective factors to reduce the person's risk factors and prevent triggers for instance of violence

UpdatePlanRequest.description: The request for updating a CSIP Plan for a CSIP record

caseManager.description: The case manager assigned to the CSIP plan.

reasonForPlan.description: The reasons motivating the creation of a CSIP plan.

nextCaseReviewDate.description: The next date the CSIP plan should be reviewed.

UpdateInterviewRequest.description: The request body to update an interview

interviewee.description: Name of the person being interviewed.

interviewDate.description: The date the interview took place.

intervieweeRoleCode.description: What role the interviewee played in the incident or referral.

UpdateContributoryFactorRequest.description: The request body to update a contributory factor to the incident that motivated the CSIP referral

factorTypeCode.description: The type of contributory factor to the incident or motivation for CSIP referral.

comment.description: Additional information about the contributory factor to the incident or motivation for CSIP referral.

UpdateReviewRequest.description: The request body to update a Review for a CSIP Plan

recordedBy.description: The username of the person who recorded the review.

recordedByDisplayName.description: The displayable name of the person who recorded the review.

nextReviewDate.description: The date of the next review.

csipClosedDate.description: The date the CSIP plan was closed following a review outcome decision to close it.

actions.description: A list of actions following the review.

isAttended.description: If the person attended the review.

identifiedNeed.description: Details of the need identified in the CSIP plan.

responsiblePerson.description: The name of the person who is responsible for taking action on the intervention.

createdDate.description: The date the need was identified.

targetDate.description: The target date the need should be progressed or resolved.

closedDate.description: The date the identified need was resolved or closed.
